    An Edit To Remember #88

    DATE:
    March 21st, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    Auto.Matic.     REACTIONS: 0

    Audio clip: Adobe Flash Player (version 9 or above) is required to play this audio clip. Download the latest version here. You also need to have JavaScript enabled in your browser.

    KC﻿ & The Sunshine Band: “I Get Lifted” [Todd Terje Edit]

    La.Ga.Sta.’s “An Edit To Remember” series continues with a re-edit from none other than Norwegian maestro Todd Terje. His solid edits of KC & The Sunshine Band’s 1975′s “I Get Lifted” and 1977′s “I’m Your Boogie Man” will finally get an official release on April 18th for Record Store Day through Miami’s TK Disco, the ’70s disco label founded by Henry Stone. The two coloured 10″ vinyls, limited to 500 copies, will feature the original track on the A-side backed with Terje’s edit. It’s a good chance to revisit his quality edit of “I Get Lifted”.

    Gasback:
    An Edit To Remember #87

    This Soft Machine: “On & On”

    DATE:
    March 19th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Having previously operated under the moniker Das Moth, the now Germany-based Australian producer/DJ Tim Sullivan returns as This Soft Machine, a “band at heart”, as he says. Next month, This Soft Machine will finally drop his superb debut EP, consisting of two tracks, “On & On” and “This Place Was Meant For Me”, which marks his first release on Eskimo Recordings. Our first taste of that forthcoming EP comes in the form of “On & On”, a perfectly crafted disco-infused tune that showcases his elegant style. On this track, Dan Whitford (of Cut Copy fame) helped with recording the synthesizers, Dave Harrington, one half of Darkside, played the electric guitar, while Lorraine Nicholson contributed vocals. It’s definitely worth a few spins. Blast it above.

    This Soft Machine’s “On & On”/”This Place Was Meant For Me” EP will drop on coloured 7″ vinyl and digitally on April 13th via Eskimo Recordings. The track “On & On” will also appear on “The Orange Collection”, the fourth installment of the label’s ongoing compilation series based around colours.

    Snakehips feat. Kaleem Taylor: “Forever (Pt. II)” Video

    DATE:
    March 18th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    London duo Snakehips, comprised of Oliver Lee and James Carter, have dropped the video for their infectious new single “Forever (Pt. II)”, featuring vocals from Kaleem Taylor. The track is taken from the pair’s debut four-track EP of the same name, out now via their own label Hoffman West. Buy it here.

    Directed by Sashinski.

    Gasback:
    Snakehips: “Gone” (feat. Syd)

    John Talabot: “Without You (Mistakes Are Ok Midnight Version)”

    DATE:
    March 17th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 1

    Spanish house wiz and Hivern Discs boss John Talabot will drop a new remix EP for his sublime tune “Without You”, first appeared on his excellent 2013 DJ-Kicks mix, for the relaunch of !K7′s “DJ-Kicks” 12″ series. The release comes backed with three remixes from Thomas Melchior under his Melchior Productions Ltd moniker, Berlin producer/DJ Oskar Offermann, and mysterious Barcelonan producer Mistakes Are Ok, whose “Midnight Version” of “Without You” can now be streamed above. And it’s just a great ride.

    The “Without You” EP will arrive on March 23 via !K7. Pre-order it here.

    Gasback:
    John Talabot: “Without You”

    Django Django: “Reflections”

    DATE:
    March 17th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    We’ve already heard and saw the video for lead single “First Light”, and now Scottish four-piece Django Django have shared another new track called “Reflections” from their forthcoming second album “Born Under Saturn”. “Reflections” is an infectious house-leaning jam with euphoric melodies that finds Django Django in such fine form. “Reflections is a story about someone who has dedicated their whole life to finding something, but only then realising that what they left behind was more important. Featuring Roller Trio’s James Mainwaring in the middle 8 on the saxophone,” explains singer and guitarist Vinnie Neff.

    Django Django’s sophomore album “Born Under Saturn”, the follow-up to 2012′s self-titled debut, will arrive on May 4th via Because Music. Pre-order it here.

    Gasback:
    Django Django: “First Light”

    Monkey Safari: “Cranes” Video

    DATE:
    March 17th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    German house duo Monkey Safari, comprised of brothers Lars and Sven, have shared a new video for their great single “Cranes” with the help of Falko Gerlinghoff, Paul Arne Meyer, and Johannes Westermann. A cool video made of 2.500 hand-drawn frames. The single “Cranes”, which comes complete with two remixes by Danish producer Kölsch and Brooklyn’s Wolf + Lamb, is out now via Monkey Safari’s own imprint Hommage. Buy it here.

    Gasback:
    Monkey Safari: “Cranes” [Wolf + Lamb Remix]

    Zimmer x Pallace: “Saturday Love”

    DATE:
    March 17th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    mpFree     REACTIONS: 0

    Parisian producer/DJ Zimmer returns to our station with his new single “Saturday Love”, a superb collaborative tune with fellow Frenchman Pallace. It’s a piano-driven house gem with an infectious bassline and Aria Lanelle’s catchy vocals. “I’ve always been a fan of piano house. “Saturday Love” is our homage to the genre, but with a modern twist. It’s a fun and playful track, and we’re really excited to share it after playing it in our DJ sets for the past months,” says Zimmer. You can now grab it for free below.

    Download here for the price of an email.

    Gasback:
    Wunder Wunder: “Midnight Hours” [Zimmer Remix]

    Duke Dumont: “The Giver (Reprise)”

    DATE:
    March 17th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    London-based house producer Duke Dumont just dropped his new single “The Giver (Reprise)”, which is a vocal version of his 2012 house anthem “The Giver”, taken from the “For Club Play Only Vol. 2″ EP on Turbo Recordings. This new version will appear on Duke’s forthcoming debut album, set to arrive later this year. Bring it on!

    “The Giver (Reprise)” will arrive on June 21 via Duke Dumont’s Blasé Boys Club imprint.
    Pre-order it here.

    Gasback:
    Duke Dumont: “Won’t Look Back”

    Jupiter: “Do It”

    DATE:
    March 16th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    After a hiatus, Parisian electro-pop duo Jupiter, comprised of Amélie De Bosredon and Quarles Baseden, are back with a new album, called “Bandana Republic”. Recorded in Paris and Los Angeles, the 10-track record follows the pair’s much played 2012 debut album “Juicy Lucy” and each track was inspired by long drives out into the Californian desert. Before it drops on May 4th via their newly-minted imprint Persephone and Grand Blanc, we’ve got our hands on the album’s first single “Do It”, a delicious slice of disco pop and it’s about as catchy as it gets. Blast it above.

    You can pre-order the album here.

    Gasback:
    Jupiter: “Juicy Lucy” {Crayon Remix)
    Jupiter: “One O Six”

    Du Tonc: “Animals”

    DATE:
    March 16th, 2015     CATEGORIES:
    News     REACTIONS: 0

    Just two months after Du Tonc broke their extended silence to drop “Every Song”, their debut release on Eskimo Recordings, the dynamic duo of London disco maestro Mighty Mouse and Matt Van Schie (of Van She fame) return to the same label with their second single of the year, called “Animals”. A bright, melodious slice of disco-tinged pop, “Animals” finds the duo delivering one of their finest works to date. With its trademark guitar riffs and a sense of melancholy, this tune will get some serious spins on our car stereo this spring.

    Du Tonc’s new single “Animals” will arrive on March 30th via Eskimo Recordings.
    Pre-order it here.

    Gasback:
    Du Tonc: “Surging Memories” (Dub)
